multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Endocrinology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have painless swelling in my left foot that has been present for 4 months.
Have you noticed any other symptoms such as fatigue, weight changes, or skin changes?
No, I haven't noticed any fatigue, weight changes, or other skin changes.
Do you have any conditions like diabetes or kidney disease, or are you taking any medications currently?
Yes, I have type 2 diabetes mellitus, and I am currently taking insulin along with other medications.
Have you experienced any injuries or infections in the swollen foot area?
No, I have not had any injuries or infections in the swollen foot area.
Have your blood sugar levels been well-controlled recently?
I'm unable to provide specific details about the control of my blood sugar levels.
Has anyone in your family experienced similar symptoms or been diagnosed with a condition affecting their feet or legs?
My mother had rheumatoid arthritis, but I'm not sure if her condition specifically affected her feet or legs in a similar way.
Have you observed any color change, feel of increased warmth, or difference in hair growth on the affected foot compared to the other?
There is no redness or warmth in the affected foot, and the description does not mention any difference in hair growth.
Final Diagnosis: Diabetic foot (Charcot neuroarthropathy)
